bestBHT.bht: When our eyes are single-seeing and our souls are free from prejudice or selfish desires, our whole being becomes illuminated with the light of divine truth. This spiritual enlightenment is emphasized by the analogy of a bright shining lamp or a flash of lightning, highlighting the moral illumination it brings. Only when our entire being is filled with this light, without any dark corners, can we fully experience the brightness and clarity of God's teachings, bringing joy and wisdom to all aspects of our being.

Henry Alford: When thine eye is single,—i.e. simple,—straight and single-seeing,—thy whole body will be light.

If the soul be so,—having no part darkened by prejudice or selfish lusts, and approach thus to His teaching, it shall be wholly illuminated by it, as by the candle of the Lord, searching its inward parts.
This saying... becomes, in its spiritual significance, a weighty declaration of truth.
Marvin Vincent: The bright shining of a candle."
The lamp with its bright shining. jAstraph means lightning.
It is used here to emphasize the idea of moral illumination.
Philip Schaff: Only when thy body is wholly illumined, without having even an obscure corner left therein, will it become so bright and clear as if the full brilliancy of a bright lamp illumined thee."
Thou wilt be placed in a normal condition of light.
The necessity of a state of soul corresponding to and affected by the light which God so fully gives is here emphasized.
Archibald T. Robertson: With its bright shining (τη αστραπη). Instrumental case, as if by a flash of lightning the light is revealed in him. See on Luke 10:18.
John Gill: If thy whole body therefore be full of light... having no part dark... the whole shall be full of light."
Every power and faculty of the soul being affected with it, and influenced by it.
The whole soul shall be as full of light and joy, which the Gospel always brings with it.
John Wesley: If thy whole body be full of light — If thou art filled with holy wisdom, having no part dark, giving way to no sin or folly...
...then that heavenly principle will, like the clear flame of a lamp in a room that was dark before...
...shed its light into all thy powers and faculties.

bhtAttempts.bht: When our eyes are simple and single-seeing, free from prejudice or selfish lusts, our whole being becomes illuminated with the light of divine truth. This saying holds great significance as it speaks to the spiritual illumination of the soul. The analogy of a bright shining lamp or the flash of lightning emphasizes the idea of moral illumination. Only when our entire being is filled with this light, without any dark corners, can we experience the full brightness and clarity of God's teachings. In this state of soul, our every power and faculty is influenced and affected by the light, filling us with joy and wisdom.

When our eyes are single-seeing and our souls are free from prejudice or selfish desires, our whole being becomes illuminated with the light of divine truth. This spiritual enlightenment is emphasized by the analogy of a bright shining lamp or a flash of lightning, highlighting the moral illumination it brings. Only when our entire being is filled with this light, without any dark corners, can we fully experience the brightness and clarity of God's teachings, bringing joy and wisdom to all aspects of our being.

When our eyes are single and simple, free from prejudice or selfish lusts, our entire being becomes illuminated by the light of divine truth. This saying carries great spiritual significance, underscoring the importance of a soul untouched by darkness. It compares the illumination to that of a bright shining lamp or a flash of lightning, emphasizing moral enlightenment. Only when our whole body is filled with this light and devoid of darkness can we experience the fullness of joy and wisdom that the Gospel brings.

When our eyes are single, simple, and free from prejudice or selfish lusts, our entire being becomes illuminated with the light of divine truth. This spiritual enlightenment, symbolized by a bright shining lamp or a flash of lightning, holds profound significance. Our soul must be untouched by darkness, fully embracing the teachings of God to experience the fullness of joy and wisdom. This illumination will penetrate every aspect of our being, influencing and affecting every power and faculty within us.

When our eyes are single, simple, and free from prejudice or selfish lusts, our whole body becomes filled with light, devoid of darkness. This spiritual illumination, symbolized by a bright shining lamp or a flash of lightning, holds great significance. It emphasizes the moral enlightenment that comes from approaching God's teachings with an open mind and heart. Only by being fully illuminated can every aspect of our being experience the brightness and clarity that the Gospel brings, filling us with joy and wisdom.
